prompt: What is the difference between the blue and gray avatars?
options: (A) The blue avatars are the Speakers, and the gray avatars are the Listeners.
(B) The blue avatars are members of the blue group you observed, and the gray avatars are naive participants who have not played the game.
(C) There is no difference between the blue and gray avatars.

prompt: What kind of feedback did the Speakers and the Listeners see during the gameplay?
options: (A) The Speakers saw each of the Listeners' guesses, and each of the Listeners saw what the correct picture was.
(B) The Speakers saw each of the Listeners' guesses, but the Listeners didn't see what the correct picture was.
(C) The Listeners saw what the correct picture was, but the speakers didn't see each of the Listeners' guesses.

prompt: What did the Speaker do in each of the rounds?
options: (A) The Speaker generated the most creative description of each of the 8 pictures, that they could think of.
(B) The Speaker described each of the 8 pictures to the Listeners. Then, the Speaker role rotated to the next player.
(C) The Speaker described a random picture to the Listeners. Then, the Speaker role rotated to the next player.

prompt: What will you be asked to do in the second part of the experiment?
options: (A) Choose between two descriptions for each picture
(B) Choose a picture and write your own description for it
(C) Rate how well different descriptions describe each picture
(D) Memorize the descriptions used by the groups

prompt: How can I earn the highest possible bonus in this task?
options: (A) By writing the most interesting descriptions for the pictures in the second part of the task.
(B) By clicking through the second part of the task as fast as possible, so that I can finish the task quickly.
(C) By paying attention to the videos in the first part of the task, so that I can pick the best choices in the second part of the task.

prompt: What is the rule about choosing pictures in the second part?
options: (A) You must choose the same picture on every trial
(B) You must choose a different picture on each trial than you chose on the previous trial
(C) You can choose any picture you want on each trial
